title: PREORGINARY SYNTHESIS [Derrida bringing together instead of dividing?]

HDG.LOG.content: [Nietzsche-like] forgetting to meditate on essential origin of reason, let itself into its advent (Ankunft) [arrival] > more originally (ursprünglicher), legein as “bringing together,” legere as lesen, collecting & bringing together (Zusammenbringen)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [Nietzsche-like] forgetting to meditate on essential origin of reason, let itself into its advent (Ankunft) [arrival] > more originally (ursprünglicher), legein as “bringing together,” legere as lesen, collecting & bringing together (Zusammenbringen)

HDG.LOG.content: gathering properly begins w/ sheltering (Bergen her eigentlich anfangende Sammeln): the vintage (die Lese) is a selection (Auslese) > most important aspect [why?] to form the vintage is the sorting (Erlesen), the fore-gathering (Vor-lese) which determines (fügt) the selection, bringing together in gathering
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: gathering properly begins w/ sheltering (Bergen her eigentlich anfangende Sammeln): the vintage (die Lese) is a selection (Auslese) > most important aspect [why?] to form the vintage is the sorting (Erlesen), the fore-gathering (Vor-lese) which determines (fügt) the selection, bringing together in gathering

HDG.LOG.content: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: a protection in which what lies before remains (bleibt) laid down: stored, laid away, secured & deposited in unconcealment (Unverborgenheit), sheltered in unconcealment > the keisthai of upokeimenon: presencing (Anwesen) of that which lies before us into unconcealment: legein concerns safety (Geborgenheit), safekeeping, gathering appropriate to such a laying [what about annihilation?], safety of that which comes together into presence (des beisammen-Anwesenden)

HDG.LOG.content: [method of plurivocity? compare to Derrida, dissemination] succeed in delineating more meaningfully a few characteristics of en and panta: delineation should remain a preliminary free-flowing sketch, not self-assured portrayal > must reflect w/in unity of Heraclitus’ saying [closed-context?]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: [method of plurivocity? compare to Derrida, dissemination] succeed in delineating more meaningfully a few characteristics of en and panta: delineation should remain a preliminary free-flowing sketch, not self-assured portrayal > must reflect w/in unity of Heraclitus’ saying [closed-context?]

HDG.LOG.content: legein: not a mere collecting or coupling of opposites which equalizes contraries, not just a connecting or binding together [Derrida, indifference point]
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: legein: not a mere collecting or coupling of opposites which equalizes contraries, not just a connecting or binding together [Derrida, indifference point]

HDG.ID.content: [by Stambaugh] German idealists place identity in center of their thought, not concerned w/ simple unity of thing w/ itself, but w/ mediated syntheses of subject/object
HDG.ID.linkedContent: [by Stambaugh] German idealists place identity in center of their thought, not concerned w/ simple unity of thing w/ itself, but w/ mediated syntheses of subject/object

HDG.IM.content: adding “instead of nothing” prevents beginning directly w/ beings as unquestionably given [?] > forfeit the self-evidence of beings > cannot wholly belong to any thing, not even ourselves ([still] Da-sein “in each case mine”) > in this question, beings come to waver (btwn Being and not-Being), questioning loses secure foothold, Dasein comes into suspense, maintains itself in suspense [what kind of maintenance is this?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: adding “instead of nothing” prevents beginning directly w/ beings as unquestionably given [?] > forfeit the self-evidence of beings > cannot wholly belong to any thing, not even ourselves ([still] Da-sein “in each case mine”) > in this question, beings come to waver (btwn Being and not-Being), questioning loses secure foothold, Dasein comes into suspense, maintains itself in suspense [what kind of maintenance is this?]

HDG.IM.content: from question “Why are there beings at all instead of nothing?” we’ve extracted the prior question (Vor-frage): How does it stand w/ Being? [Nietzsche’s putting first last [fixerup]]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: from question “Why are there beings at all instead of nothing?” we’ve extracted the prior question (Vor-frage): How does it stand w/ Being? [Nietzsche’s putting first last [fixerup]]

HDG.IM.content: what does “world” mean? [cf. Derrida in ATIA]

HDG.BC.content: “Ground-concepts” calls us to come to stand where a footing & a permanence are granted, where all decisions are made, but also where indecisiveness borrows its hiding places [relate to Derrida, undecidable]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “Ground-concepts” calls us to come to stand where a footing & a permanence are granted, where all decisions are made, but also where indecisiveness borrows its hiding places [relate to Derrida, undecidable]

HDG.BC.content: “poetic propositions” : “poetic” is the exception, things don’t lie as much on surface as they do in familiar [would Derrida agree?] > “is” derives [schöpft?] its meaning from being represented/addressed/articulated in proposition [Being needs beings]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: “poetic propositions” : “poetic” is the exception, things don’t lie as much on surface as they do in familiar [would Derrida agree?] > “is” derives [schöpft?] its meaning from being represented/addressed/articulated in proposition [Being needs beings]

HDG.BC.content: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: clock stops, we become aware of “is,” an interruption intrudes on speaking [attention beyond time?] > can only experience interruption hypothetically [yes! Derrida, Nietzsche, bell tolls]

HDG.BC.content: Being as its own opposite: a discord (Zwiespalt) w/in Being itself > but this discordant character, as essential to Being, is held together in unity of an essence: das Sein gerade nicht zerspalten sein im Sinne einer Zerstörung seines Wesens [Being cannot be split in sense of destruction of its essence]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Being as its own opposite: a discord (Zwiespalt) w/in Being itself > but this discordant character, as essential to Being, is held together in unity of an essence: das Sein gerade nicht zerspalten sein im Sinne einer Zerstörung seines Wesens [Being cannot be split in sense of destruction of its essence]

HDG.BC.content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.BT.content: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])
HDG.BT.linkedContent: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])

HDG.WM.content: Being is finite [?] > nothing & Being belong together [are the same] because being itself is essentially finite, manifests itself only in transcendence of a Dasein held out into the nothing
HDG.WM.linkedContent: Being is finite [?] > nothing & Being belong together [are the same] because being itself is essentially finite, manifests itself only in transcendence of a Dasein held out into the nothing

HDG.IWM.content: thinking attempted in Being and Time is “under way (unterwegs)” toward bringing thinking onto a way, toward opening a path for thinking [not there yet, telos, preparatory, provisional] > how could this conjecture (experienced here [really???]), that relation of Being to human essence belongs to Being itself, become explicit before every attempt to liberate Dasein from subjectivity, etc. [had to go through destruction via meaning of Being to think truth of Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: thinking attempted in Being and Time is “under way (unterwegs)” toward bringing thinking onto a way, toward opening a path for thinking [not there yet, telos, preparatory, provisional] > how could this conjecture (experienced here [really???]), that relation of Being to human essence belongs to Being itself, become explicit before every attempt to liberate Dasein from subjectivity, etc. [had to go through destruction via meaning of Being to think truth of Being]

HDG.QB.content: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: presencing (“being”) always presencing directed toward human essence, presencing as a call (Geheiss) that calls upon human essence > human essence as such is a hearing, belongs to calling of this call, the approach of presencing > that which is the Same (“being”?) each time: belonging together of call & hearing—“What am I saying? It is no longer ‘being’ at all” [beyond Being] > relinquish isolating/separating word “being” just as decisively as name “human being” [can never call human being and being same] [hermeneutic circle leads beyond Being, beyond itself?]

HDG.QB.content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

HDG.FS.content: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: xynon means same as koinon? > for Heraclitus, xynienai: going together; koinon merely katholon, the universal, i.e. “what belongs equally to all despite differences” [a going together that’s not the universal common] > co-belonging of xynon is differing (verschieden) (to diapheromenon), this alone can bring together (zusammenbringen): no night alone, no day alone, co-belonging of day/night (their very being) [not dialectic?]

HDG.FS.content: matter (Sache) itself is sole authority, in seminar we work in common, text is only a means (Mittel), not an end (Ziel) [cf. Derrida] > in genuine seminar, teacher learns the most, he must listen rightly (rechte Hören) to the text > nothing ever to be believed, must be experienced [secret (Geheimnis) of seminar, be able to read Hegel’s whole book]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: matter (Sache) itself is sole authority, in seminar we work in common, text is only a means (Mittel), not an end (Ziel) [cf. Derrida] > in genuine seminar, teacher learns the most, he must listen rightly (rechte Hören) to the text > nothing ever to be believed, must be experienced [secret (Geheimnis) of seminar, be able to read Hegel’s whole book]

HDG.FS.content: system: 1) syn: together, gathering, power of conjoining 2) tithēmi: to posit (setzen), positing of Being as objectivity [Kant]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: system: 1) syn: together, gathering, power of conjoining 2) tithēmi: to posit (setzen), positing of Being as objectivity [Kant]

HDG.FS.content: for Kant, power of conjoining withdraws before the Understanding, unity hasn’t disappeared but remains in background > over-interpreting, Reason as faculty of unity, perceiving of Being, withdraws behind Understanding (for Kant): ontological difference is at stake (im Spiel ist) > understanding can’t grasp/determine absolute synthesis
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Kant, power of conjoining withdraws before the Understanding, unity hasn’t disappeared but remains in background > over-interpreting, Reason as faculty of unity, perceiving of Being, withdraws behind Understanding (for Kant): ontological difference is at stake (im Spiel ist) > understanding can’t grasp/determine absolute synthesis

HDG.FS.content: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element
HDG.FS.linkedContent: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

HDG.FS.content: for Hegel, production of Absolute: Gestalt of reflection’s accomplishment (Vollzugs) > Absolute brought forth before consciousness, i.e. pro-duced, not making but “letting appear (erscheinen Lassen)” > this pro-duction is a construction (architectonic) that means: Zusammengehöriges im Sich-zeigen des Absoluten als zusammengehörig zusammenbauen (zusammenstellen) [belonging together in self-showing (of Absolute) as belonging together that builds together (a setting together)]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Hegel, production of Absolute: Gestalt of reflection’s accomplishment (Vollzugs) > Absolute brought forth before consciousness, i.e. pro-duced, not making but “letting appear (erscheinen Lassen)” > this pro-duction is a construction (architectonic) that means: Zusammengehöriges im Sich-zeigen des Absoluten als zusammengehörig zusammenbauen (zusammenstellen) [belonging together in self-showing (of Absolute) as belonging together that builds together (a setting together)]

HDG.FS.content: [machine & event] difficult of thinking together question concerning technology & question of being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [machine & event] difficult of thinking together question concerning technology & question of being

HDG.FS.content: ontological determination of standing reserve not permanence but orderability, persistent standing-at-one’s-disposal (zur-Verfügung-stehen)—for consumption in planning of whole > replaceability (Ersetzbarkeit) essential to way of being today, every being essentially replaceable [cf. Derrida on substitution], Ersetzbarsein > for example: fashion > time becomes current affairs (Aktualität), continual novelty of incessant change [obsession w/ new] [Heidegger wonders whether May ’68 realized all this]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: ontological determination of standing reserve not permanence but orderability, persistent standing-at-one’s-disposal (zur-Verfügung-stehen)—for consumption in planning of whole > replaceability (Ersetzbarkeit) essential to way of being today, every being essentially replaceable [cf. Derrida on substitution], Ersetzbarsein > for example: fashion > time becomes current affairs (Aktualität), continual novelty of incessant change [obsession w/ new] [Heidegger wonders whether May ’68 realized all this]

HDG.FS.content: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Kantian “Copernican revolution”: the thing is adjusted in advance to power of knowing, category “substance” brings manifold of hyletic data into definite form, object posited as synthesis of intuition/concept > for Kant, knowledge = bringing-into-form (accomplished by understanding)

HDG.FS.content: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself
HDG.FS.linkedContent: ontological determination of imperative (Zwang): Ge-stell > in Ge-, one hears gathering, unification, bringing together of all modes of positing (Stellens) > positing as a challenging (Herausfordern), nature is held to (Anhaltens zu) something, forced to adopt a certain form, to play a role > if nature is posed (gestellt) to deliver its energy, man is set (gestellt) to encounter/correspond to these produced energies: the greater the challenging of nature, greater challenge man imposes on himself

HDG.MA.content: [Derrida beyond Heidegger] [Heidegger describes the homelessness of those who watch Television, listen to radio, go to movies] the rootedness (Bodenständigkeit), the autochthony, of man threatened today at its core: loss of autochthony springs from spirit of age in which we were born: the atomic age (atom bomb: its most conspicuous symbol)
HDG.MA.linkedContent: [Derrida beyond Heidegger] [Heidegger describes the homelessness of those who watch Television, listen to radio, go to movies] the rootedness (Bodenständigkeit), the autochthony, of man threatened today at its core: loss of autochthony springs from spirit of age in which we were born: the atomic age (atom bomb: its most conspicuous symbol)

HDG.MA.content: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]
HDG.MA.linkedContent: can a new ground/foundation be granted gain to man? new authochthony? > perhaps answer is near, near is always longest/hardest for humans > meditative thinking demands we not cling one-sidedly to a single idea: engage ourselves w/ what, at 1st sight, doesn’t go together at all [not a monomaniacal thought]

HDG.MA.content: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things & openness to mystery (Geheimnis) belong together: give vision of new autochtony which might recapture autochtony in changed form
HDG.MA.linkedContent: releasement (Gelassenheit) toward things & openness to mystery (Geheimnis) belong together: give vision of new autochtony which might recapture autochtony in changed form

HDG.CCP.content: the region gathers, each to each, while resting in itself: “regioning is a gathering and re-sheltering (versammelnde Zurückbergen) for an expanded resting (Beruhen) in an abiding (Weile)” [Gegnet], in Gegnet, openness is halted and held [Derrida beyond Heidegger]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: the region gathers, each to each, while resting in itself: “regioning is a gathering and re-sheltering (versammelnde Zurückbergen) for an expanded resting (Beruhen) in an abiding (Weile)” [Gegnet], in Gegnet, openness is halted and held [Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.CCP.content: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: how movement comes from rest suddenly clearer to me > scientist causes great embarrassment, asking: “how far is it really Gelassenheit into which I tried to let myself?” > what we designate w/ a word doesn’t have that word hanging on it (like a name plate) > whatever we name has been nameless before > how can we decide the adequacy of a name? or is all designation arbitrary? > is there the nameless at all? or does the name not occur to us? > p. 71 perhaps names are not the result of designation but the occurring together of the nameable, name, & named (nature of words)

HDG.CCP.content: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: one often doesn’t know whose tale he retells [baby daddy] > releasement as experience of waiting: release oneself into openness of Gegnet, waiting a relation to Gegnet, perhaps the relation > “relation to something would be the true relation if it were held in its own nature by that which it relates” [hetero-tautology, Derrida beyond Heidegger]

HDG.CCP.content: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called
HDG.CCP.linkedContent: night neighbors the stars, binds together w/out seam, edge or thread [Derrida beyond Heidegger] > neighbors because she works only w/ nearness > wondering upon depths of the height > wonder can open what is locked > by way of waiting > if this is released > and human nature remains appropriated to that > from whence we’re called

HDG.DL.content: [re: “Expression and Meaning (Ausdruck und Bedeutung [double takes on Erscheinung]”] I was concerned to make visible (sichtbar machen) das ganz Andere [the totally other], which [at that time], I had only an obscure (dunkel) or confused intimation (verworren Geahnte) [Derrida beyond Heidegger: can’t make totally other visible]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [re: “Expression and Meaning (Ausdruck und Bedeutung [double takes on Erscheinung]”] I was concerned to make visible (sichtbar machen) das ganz Andere [the totally other], which [at that time], I had only an obscure (dunkel) or confused intimation (verworren Geahnte) [Derrida beyond Heidegger: can’t make totally other visible]

HDG.DL.content: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Die Achtsamkeit auf die Spuren, die das Denken in seinen Quellbereich weisen [give heed to trails (traces) that direct thinking back to region of its source] [for Derrida the traces are the source in such a way that there is no source to think back to] > do you find these traces? > I find them because they’re not of my making (stammen), because they’re rarely discernible, like the wind-borne echo of a distant call (fernen Zurufes) [annihilation of trace]

HDG.DL.content: see Section 34 in Being and Time, see more clearly why hermeneutics & language belong together
HDG.DL.linkedContent: see Section 34 in Being and Time, see more clearly why hermeneutics & language belong together

HDG.LP.content: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature
HDG.LP.linkedContent: site (Ort), [originally means] die Spitze des Speers (point of the spear) [Derrida repeatedly refers to this statement], gathers into itself, to the highest and most extreme (Äusserste), a gathering that penetrates (durchdringt)/pervades (durchwest) everything > a site gathers & preserves (verwahrt) what it gathers, not like an encapsulated shell (Kapsel), but by shining through, lighting up, and thus releasing (entlässt) what it gathers to its own nature

HDG.LP.content: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Geschlecht (kin, kind, generation): a human cast away (verschlagene) from Menschenwesen, stamped (geprägte) in one cast (einem Schlag) > Geschlecht: both mankind as a whole and kinship of race, tribe, family, all of these stamped in the duality of the sexes (Zwiefache der Geschlechter), decomposed form of man, man unsettled (entsetzte) > a curse (Fluch) has struck man [cf. Derrida on Geschlecht, 2nd blow of sexes] > not duality (Zwiefache) but discord (Zwietracht) is the curse

HDG.LP.content: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static
HDG.LP.linkedContent: via Trakl, apartness is spiritual/ghostly (geistlich), vom Geist bestimmt, but not “of the spirit (geistig)” (in metaphysical sense) > for Trakl, in “Grodek,” spirit is flaming, not pneuma (ethereal), but a flame that inflames, startles (aufjagt), horrifies (entsetzt), shatters us, the glowing lumination > flame is the ek-stasis (Ausser-sich), which lightens and calls forth radiance, but may go on consuming (weiterfressen) and reduce (verzehren) all to white ashes [cf. Derrida on absolute ash] > “Flame is the palest pallor’s brother” > Geist, for Trakl, as gheis (ghost), a being terrified (aufgebracht), beside himself (entsetzt), ek-static

HDG.LP.content: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]
HDG.LP.linkedContent: Geist (ghost or spirit), via Trakl, possibility of both gentleness and destructiveness (Zerstörerischen) > Das Sanfte [gentleness] schlägt jenes Außer-sich des Entflammenden keineswegs nieder, sondern hält es in der Ruhe des Freundlichen versammelt [holds ek-stasis in peace of friendship] > Das Zerstörerische [destructiveness] kommt aus dem Zügellosen, das sich im eigenen Aufruhr verzehrt und so das Bösartige betreibt [consumes itself, unbridled evil] > evil is ghostly, the revolt (Aufruhr) of a terror blazing away in blindness, the ungathered, fragmented, unholy—threatens to turn gentleness to ash (des Sanften zu versengen droht) [cf. Derrida on absolute ash]

HDG.LP.content: on the Christianity of Trakl: why doesn’t he call out to God/Christ? why does he call instead to “sister’s swaying shadow,” calling her “the greeting one”? > a Lament not about redemption, a lament that urges Sister to look
HDG.LP.linkedContent: on the Christianity of Trakl: why doesn’t he call out to God/Christ? why does he call instead to “sister’s swaying shadow,” calling her “the greeting one”? > a Lament not about redemption, a lament that urges Sister to look

HDG.WL.content: [method] speak about speech qua speech (Die Sprache als die Sprache zur Sprache bringen): each Sprache says something different yet the Same > this Same, the oneness that’s the distinctive property of language, holds together (zueinanderhält) what is kept separate (Auseinandergehaltene)
HDG.WL.linkedContent: [method] speak about speech qua speech (Die Sprache als die Sprache zur Sprache bringen): each Sprache says something different yet the Same > this Same, the oneness that’s the distinctive property of language, holds together (zueinanderhält) what is kept separate (Auseinandergehaltene)

HDG.WL.content: a web compresses, obstructs the straight clear view (gerade Durchsicht) in its mesh (Verflochtenen) [condensation] > we can’t disregard web of language, what seems its hopeless tangle > attempt to loosen the web to view the “open togetherness (freie Zusammengehören) of the relations named in the formula”: try to experience unbinding bond (entbindende Band) in web of language
HDG.WL.linkedContent: a web compresses, obstructs the straight clear view (gerade Durchsicht) in its mesh (Verflochtenen) [condensation] > we can’t disregard web of language, what seems its hopeless tangle > attempt to loosen the web to view the “open togetherness (freie Zusammengehören) of the relations named in the formula”: try to experience unbinding bond (entbindende Band) in web of language

HDG.WL.content: what is speaking (Sprechen), the expression of thought, if we think of its origin as the inner activity of spirit (inneren Geistestätigkeit)? > acc. modern thought, labor of spirit (Arbeit des Geistes) is a setting/positing (Setzen) (thesis), spirit conceived as subject, represented w/in subject-object model (Schema), so positing must be synthesis btwn subject/object
HDG.WL.linkedContent: what is speaking (Sprechen), the expression of thought, if we think of its origin as the inner activity of spirit (inneren Geistestätigkeit)? > acc. modern thought, labor of spirit (Arbeit des Geistes) is a setting/positing (Setzen) (thesis), spirit conceived as subject, represented w/in subject-object model (Schema), so positing must be synthesis btwn subject/object

HDG.WL.content: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name
HDG.WL.linkedContent: diversity of elements in language, an original count (Zählen) not yet enumerable, a belonging together shows itself (ergab sich) > the count is a recounting that anticipates (auf vorblickt) the Einigende im Zusammengëhoren, but can’t make it appear > long history of inability to experience unifying unity of Sprachwesens, thus it remains w/out a name

HDG.WL.content: is Saying the stream of stillness that forms (bildet)/joins (verbindet) its own two banks (Ufer): the Saying and our saying after it (unser Nachsagen)? [in forming joins: contra Derrida]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: is Saying the stream of stillness that forms (bildet)/joins (verbindet) its own two banks (Ufer): the Saying and our saying after it (unser Nachsagen)? [in forming joins: contra Derrida]

HDG.WL.content: poetry/thinking belong together: speak to the unspoken, a thought as thanks
HDG.WL.linkedContent: poetry/thinking belong together: speak to the unspoken, a thought as thanks

HDG.EC.content: [bringing 2 definitions of man together, thought & mortality, via attention & waiting] gathering toward the One of logos: something like attentiveness (Achtamsigkeit) prevails (waltet) > and isn’t attentiveness like the constant waiting on the pure coming > naturally this waiting essence remains unspoken [in both definitions]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: [bringing 2 definitions of man together, thought & mortality, via attention & waiting] gathering toward the One of logos: something like attentiveness (Achtamsigkeit) prevails (waltet) > and isn’t attentiveness like the constant waiting on the pure coming > naturally this waiting essence remains unspoken [in both definitions]

HDG.EC.content: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]
HDG.EC.linkedContent: the coming: that before (voraus) which nothing can be thought, the unprethinkable (das Unvordenkliche) [cf. Derrida to-come] > what heals can’t be set forth in propositional statements (in aussagenden Sätzen darstellen), but only conversationally surmised (gesprächsweise vermuten) [Derrida would say it can only be marked on the margins, nor would he call it what heals]

HDG.OHF.content: for Heidegger, hermeneutics (in connection [Anschluss] w/ its original meaning): definite unity in the actualizing (bestimmte Einheit des Vollzugs) of ermēneuein (communication), i.e. of the interpreting (Auslegens) of facticity: encountering, seeing, concept bringing
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: for Heidegger, hermeneutics (in connection [Anschluss] w/ its original meaning): definite unity in the actualizing (bestimmte Einheit des Vollzugs) of ermēneuein (communication), i.e. of the interpreting (Auslegens) of facticity: encountering, seeing, concept bringing

HDG.OHF.content: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [re: historical human sciences] [a pre-critique of Foucault?] each culture interrogated re: expressive being of its formation (Ausdruckseins ihrer Gebilde), on basis of its style, bringing into relief (Abhebung) the Gestaltcharaktere des Gestalthaften: morphology > one culture must be held up against another, method of universally comparing forms (Gestaltvergleichung) (homology, analogy, synchronism, parallelism) > “a closed form-endowed context (Zusammenhang) of forms”: totality of historical past explicated in such a way, a flattening down (Niederschlag) [translator frustratingly prefers word condensation here], can be mastered at a glance (in einem Blick), can order via charts/rubrics [classifying (Ordnung)]

HDG.OHF.content: [cf. OPEN in Derrida] historical consciousness is “there,” brings itself into open publicity (Öffentlichkeit) w/ a definite self-interpretation (bestimmten Selbstauslegung)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [cf. OPEN in Derrida] historical consciousness is “there,” brings itself into open publicity (Öffentlichkeit) w/ a definite self-interpretation (bestimmten Selbstauslegung)

HDG.OHF.content: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: historical consciousness gives itself task of overviewing “total fact of man (die ganze Tatsache Mensch),” bringing Dasein into view absolutely objectively > in this approach to past, the present of Dasein (Gegenwart des Daseins) is before itself in equally objective manner, & so is the future (not yet [Noch-nicht], just the present when calculated, anticipated by way of comparison): Spengler’s “decline of the West” not cheap witticism or whim, but consequential expression of historical consciousness: its inauthenticity thought through to the end [i.e. if we think of everything in this reductive way, then we have reduced our future]

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger believes it is best [why?] to treat everything said in today’s philosophy as pure/incontrovertible truth, not interested in truth/falsity of proposition but what goes on in this philosophy before it becomes what it is (was in dieser Philosophie vor sich geht) [hermeneutics as prior to philosophy] > methodology/logic couldn’t produce proper explanation because it would be a theory in same sense as this philosophy itself > Heidegger’s analysis will reactivate (nachvollziehen) step by step the context of its actualization (Vollzugszusammenhang) [cf. Derrida], bringing into relief how the object stands in view, how it is questioned, looked at, how concepts are being drawn (geschöpft) from it: ein Anspruch ganz primitiver Art (a quite primitive kind of claim/demand): can’t supply a basis (Boden) for this analysis

HDG.OHF.content: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [method: Heidegger now tries to show what is there for Dasein in the 2 interpretative modes (philosophy, historical consciousness)] Dasein itself goes toward something, having itself objectively there for itself, bringing itself objectively into its there > historical consciousness & philosophy are modes of Dasein, paths held open (preserved in itself), paths of securing/making certain, paths of falling away > Dasein encounters itself free of standpoints in objective certainty: 1) historical consciousness, Dasein encounters wealth of objective being of its having-been (Gewesenseins) 2) philosophy, Dasein encounters immutability of its always-being-in-such-a-manner (Immersoseins) > both interpretations bring Dasein before its highest & pure present

HDG.OHF.content: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [encounter others] appearance of a with-world, not object of knowing, but Vorhandenheit > advance appearance (Vorschein) of factical lives of others: “in a with-world” > others encountered in the “with-”world as others bringing w/ them the “one-self”

HDG.OHF.content: to understand phenomenal context of significance: must see that its disclosedness stands in respective kind of care that tarries for awhile at a particular time (die Erschlossenheit in der jeweiligen Sorge steht): der Verweisungszusammenhang selbst ist das Besorgte > context of references is the environs in the authentic sense (eigentlich Umhafte), caring as a going around (Umgehen), going-here-and-there [cf. TEXT in Derrida] > significance (ontologically defined): the with-which of dealings (Umgang) with which our being cares
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: to understand phenomenal context of significance: must see that its disclosedness stands in respective kind of care that tarries for awhile at a particular time (die Erschlossenheit in der jeweiligen Sorge steht): der Verweisungszusammenhang selbst ist das Besorgte > context of references is the environs in the authentic sense (eigentlich Umhafte), caring as a going around (Umgehen), going-here-and-there [cf. TEXT in Derrida] > significance (ontologically defined): the with-which of dealings (Umgang) with which our being cares

HDG.OHF.content: der Einsatz (initial engagement & bringing into play), “as what” facticity is grasped/stirred in advance, arises out of fundamental experience, out of truth of primordial self-interpretation of philosophy
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: der Einsatz (initial engagement & bringing into play), “as what” facticity is grasped/stirred in advance, arises out of fundamental experience, out of truth of primordial self-interpretation of philosophy

HDG.OHF.content: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: uncovering essential laws (Wesensgesetze entdecken)! “horrid wretchedness (grausende Elend) of such systematic seduction of our fellow human beings” > passing off presuppositions as harmless by means of formalizing rationalization, bringing them to Public as such

HDG.OHF.content: als bedeutet und bedeutend deuten: das Besorgen [pointing, signifying, care] > etwas bedeutet etwas: hebt es in bestimmten Verweisungszusammenhang, bestimmt sich aus dem Seienden, es ist da [thereness as signifying, as bringing into a definite context of references] — — self-evidence of the “ there ” : das Aufgehen absorption)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: als bedeutet und bedeutend deuten: das Besorgen [pointing, signifying, care] > etwas bedeutet etwas: hebt es in bestimmten Verweisungszusammenhang, bestimmt sich aus dem Seienden, es ist da [thereness as signifying, as bringing into a definite context of references] — — self-evidence of the “ there ” : das Aufgehen absorption)
